author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to analyze a file hash within a system or network. This includes implementing mechanisms to compute, verify, and analyze file hashes, ensuring that files can be uniquely identified and their integrity assessed based on their content. It is essential for maintaining data integrity, detecting malicious files, and enhancing overall security posture by providing a reliable method for file identification and verification.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
File system access and forensic tools for file analysis and manipulation.

title: Establish Ability to Analyze File Hash

references.name: NIST SP 800-137: Information Security Continuous Monitoring (ISCM)
MITRE ATT&CK: Discovery Tactics and Detection Strategies
CISA Zero Trust Architecture - Monitoring and Analytics
